member.name: ISeekingPassThru.Init

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The Init method initializes the seeking helper object.

member.param: Boolean value that specifies whether the filter is a renderer. Use the value TRUE if the filter is a renderer, or FALSE otherwise.
Pointer to the interface on the input pin of the filter.

returns.para: Returns one of the following HRESULT values.

listheader.description: Not enough memory to create the object.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer, , and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation. Those features have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer, IMFMediaEngine and Audio/Video Capture in Media Foundation instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The ISeekingPassThru interface creates a helper object that implements seeking for one-input filters. Filters can use this interface to implement the and interfaces. For more information, see CPosPassThru.
Applications do not use this interface.
